class_notes:
This course satisfies the Religion major requirement:- Tradition-Christianity.
This course will explore the diverse reality of contemporary Catholicism, a global religious tradition with roughly 1.2 billion members. We will discuss the theological, political, and cultural commitments and debates that have shaped Catholicism over centuries. Throughout the semester, we will explore these questions not only by looking to history, but also by analyzing a number of contemporary issues including gender and sexuality, the environment, and bioethics. As we explore these various aspects of modern Catholicism, we will engage a number of resources including official church documents, theological texts, art and literature, and ritual.
course_description: Examination of major social, ethical, and theological issues confronting post-Vatican II Catholicism, including the intellectual and historical roots of contemporary debates.
